trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with TimeOffManager | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with TimeOffManager | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use TimeOffManager with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use TimeOffManager with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with TimeOffManager
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with TimeOffManager

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and TimeOffManager.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and TimeOffManager.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A TimeOffManager single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A TimeOffManager single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to TimeOffManager will be able to single sign into the application at your TimeOffManager company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to TimeOffManager will be able to single sign into the application at your TimeOffManager company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for TimeOffManager
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for TimeOffManager

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for TimeOffManager
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for TimeOffManager

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for TimeOffManager.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for TimeOffManager.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for TimeOffManager, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for TimeOffManager, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type TimeOffManager.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type TimeOffManager.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select TimeOffManager, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select TimeOffManager, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TimeOffManager</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TimeOffManager</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to TimeOffManager with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to TimeOffManager with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your TimeOffManager tenant.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to upload a base-64 encoded certificate to your TimeOffManager tenant.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the TimeOffManager application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the TimeOffManager application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to TimeOffManager page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to TimeOffManager page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the TimeOffManager Reply URL textbox, type your TimeOffManager AssertionConsumerService URL (e.g.: "Example: https://www.timeoffmanager.com/cpanel/sso/consume.aspx?company\_id=IC34216", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the TimeOffManager Reply URL textbox, type your TimeOffManager AssertionConsumerService URL (e.g.: "Example: https://www.timeoffmanager.com/cpanel/sso/consume.aspx?company\_id=IC34216", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can get the reply URL from the TimeOffManager Single Sign on setting page.
trans-unit.target: You can get the reply URL from the TimeOffManager Single Sign on setting page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at TimeOffManager page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at TimeOffManager page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your TimeOffManager company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your TimeOffManager company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Account \> Account Options \> Single Sign-On Settings.
trans-unit.target: Go to Account \> Account Options \> Single Sign-On Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Single Sign-On Settings section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Single Sign-On Settings section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Create a Base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a Base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <link><linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste the entire Certificate into X.509 Certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste the entire Certificate into X.509 Certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at TimeOffManager dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Idp Issuer textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at TimeOffManager dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Idp Issuer textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at TimeOffManager dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Endpoint URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at TimeOffManager dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the IdP Endpoint URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: As Enforce SAML, select No.
trans-unit.target: As Enforce SAML, select No.

trans-unit.source: As Auto-Create Users, select Yes.
trans-unit.target: As Auto-Create Users, select Yes.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at TimeOffManager dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at TimeOffManager dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Changes.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at TimeOffManager dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at TimeOffManager dialog page, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>saml token attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>saml token attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Attribute Name
trans-unit.target: Attribute Name

trans-unit.source: Attribute Value
trans-unit.target: Attribute Value

trans-unit.source: Firstname
trans-unit.target: Firstname

trans-unit.source: User.givenname
trans-unit.target: User.givenname

trans-unit.source: Lastname
trans-unit.target: Lastname

trans-unit.source: User.surname
trans-unit.target: User.surname

trans-unit.source: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.
trans-unit.target: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Value textbox, select the attribute value shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Value textbox, select the attribute value shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: Click Apply Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply Changes.

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into TimeOffManager, they must be provisioned to TimeOffManager.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into TimeOffManager, they must be provisioned to TimeOffManager.

trans-unit.source: TimeOffManager supports just in time user provisioning.
trans-unit.target: TimeOffManager supports just in time user provisioning.

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you.

trans-unit.source: The users are added automatically during the first login using single sign on.
trans-unit.target: The users are added automatically during the first login using single sign on.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other TimeOffManager user account creation tools or APIs provided by TimeOffManager to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other TimeOffManager user account creation tools or APIs provided by TimeOffManager to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to TimeOffManager, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to TimeOffManager, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the TimeOffManager application integration page, click Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the TimeOffManager application integration page, click Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
